message.content:
We start by extracting the key amounts from the provided statements.

Step 1. From the balance sheet (all ending figures):
• Current Assets = 9,625,738.03  
• Current Liabilities = 628,478.02  
• Total Assets = 14,534,228.78  
• (Since no non‐current liabilities are shown, we assume total liabilities = current liabilities = 628,478.02)

Step 2. From the cash flow statement:
• Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = –650,630.22  
• Purchase of Fixed Assets = 0.00  
Thus, Free Cash Flow (FCF) = Operating Cash Flow – Capital Expenditures = –650,630.22 – 0.00 = –650,630.22

Step 3. From the income statement:
• Total Revenue = 2,869,560.42  
• Gross Profit = 1,620,560.42  
• Net Profit = 905,750.76  

Now we calculate each ratio:

1. Current Ratio  
= Current Assets / Current Liabilities  
= 9,625,738.03 / 628,478.02  
≈ 15.32

2. Gross Profit Margin  
= (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%  
= (1,620,560.42 / 2,869,560.42) × 100%  
≈ 56.48%

3. Debt to Asset Ratio  
= Total Liabilities / Total Assets  
= 628,478.02 / 14,534,228.78  
≈ 0.0432 (or about 0.04 when rounded)

4. Net Profit Margin  
= (Net Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%  
= (905,750.76 / 2,869,560.42) × 100%  
≈ 31.58%

5. Cash to Current Debt Ratio  
For this ratio we use the total cash (Cash on Hand + Bank Deposits) divided by Current Liabilities.  
Cash on Hand = 3,057,369.78  
Bank Deposits = 4,292,000.00  
Sum = 7,349,369.78  
Thus, Ratio = 7,349,369.78 / 628,478.02 ≈ 11.70

6. Free Cash Flow (FCF)  
= –650,630.22

7. Return on Assets (ROA)  
= (Net Profit / Total Assets) × 100%  
= (905,750.76 / 14,534,228.78) × 100%  
≈ 6.23%

Putting it all together in the required JSON format, we have:

{
  "solution": {
    "Current Ratio": "15.32",
    "Gross Profit Margin": "56.48%",
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.04",
    "Net Profit Margin": "31.58%",
    "Cash to Current Debt Ratio": "11.70",
    "Free Cash Flow (FCF)": "-650630.22",
    "Return on Assets (ROA)": "6.23%"
  }
}
